sen.e: School of foreign languages (old education system) is a group of higher education schools that were, among those specialty schools under the old education system that existed until the school system reform was conducted after the end of World War II, dedicated to learning of foreign languages and renamed "foreign affairs college" (or foreign language college) during WWII (which are therefore different from schools of foreign languages established as vocational schools).
